office: Senior Democratic House member and Committee Ranking Member
key_responsibilities: developing policy and legislative initiatives and advising Member on all legislative issues
managing long-term and short-term legislative planning
monitoring legislative activity on the House floor
supervising all legislative staff in the personal office
ensuring effective coordination between the personal office and committee office
assisting with hearing preparation as needed
requirements: results-oriented problem solver
proven track record of developing and advancing legislation
excellent oral and written communication skills
time-management skills
ability to quickly analyze and summarize complex legislative details
advanced degree
extensive experience on Capitol Hill

office: The Committee on Natural Resources’ Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations
key_responsibilities: staffing Subcommittee hearings as well as some Full Committee hearings
sending and receiving Subcommittee correspondence to and from the Executive Branch as well as with outside organizations
managing the Subcommittee’s administrative needs
requirements: strong interest in investigations and natural resources issues
strong work ethic
attention to detail
desire to learn how to conduct congressional oversight and investigations
self-motivated
prior Hill experience preferred

office: The House Committee on Homeland Security
key_responsibilities: Managing Committee hearings and markups
Planning and managing Committee field hearings
Maintaining Committee legislative calendar
Preparing Committee archive and historical records
requirements: detail oriented
self-starter
works well independently as well as with others
at least 1 year of prior Capitol Hill experience

key_responsibilities: conducting investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff of the U.S. House of Representatives
requirements: ability to conduct impartial investigations and refrain from political or partisan activity
outstanding analytical and written/oral communications skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: government ethics; criminal law; employment law, including the laws governing sexual harassment in the workplace; civil litigation; administrative investigations and adjudications; depositions; and financial accounting

office: Senior, active member of appropriations committee
key_responsibilities: handling health issues, including appropriations, budget, and tax policy
requirements: experience working on the Hill
related policy experience preferred

key_responsibilities: working with the Congresswoman and the legislative team on developing and implementing a communications strategy
managing social media platforms
maintaining the office website
briefing the Congresswoman before interviews
writing talking points for the Congresswoman’s speaking engagements, events, and floor speeches
drafting op-eds
pitching stories
requirements: talented writer
previous communications experience
ability to work quickly under pressure in a fast paced work environment
creativity
high attention to detail
hard work
Hill experience a plus

key_responsibilities: pitching reporters and producers
managing local press outreach and social media platforms
drafting statements, op-eds and other press materials as needed
requirements: at least five years’ experience executing media plans and proven success pitching/booking national cable interviews
excellent writing, editing and verbal skills
ability to manage pressure and meet deadlines

office: Southern conservative Republican member of the Energy and Commerce Committee
key_responsibilities: coordinating Member’s legislative agenda on relevant committee work and overseeing other issues within the applicant’s skills and interests
requirements: firm grasp on the legislative process
track record of passing legislation
in depth knowledge of the regulatory and legislative framework surrounding health care
experience in health care delivery a plus
excellent writing, verbal, and organizational skills
ability to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment while maintaining a positive attitude

office: The Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
key_responsibilities: depositions
transcribed interviews
briefings
congressional hearings
requirements: junior attorney (fewer than five years of experience)
background or strong interest in investigations
superior attention to detail
ability to work well under pressure
self-motivated
excellent written and oral communication skills
